title: US halts all asylum claim decisions after National Guard shooting
content: The directive comes hours after Donald Trump said the US will pause migration from "third-world countries".

title: Planes grounded after Airbus discovers solar radiation could impact systems
content: The issue is thought to affect 6,000 planes, which will need to undergo an urgent software update or have computers replaced.

title: Zelensky's top adviser resigns after anti-corruption raid on his home
content: Andriy Yermak, 54, has been the Ukrainian president's chief of staff throughout Russia's full-scale war.

title: We searched for a true Christmas market - and may have found one
content: We visited festive markets in the UK and Germany to check which come closest to the real deal.

title: Nigeria blames jihadist groups for wave of kidnappings but others accuse criminal gangs
content: Analysts instead blame criminal gangs for the kidnapping of more than 250 schoolchildren last week.

title: Three days of mourning begin after Hong Kong's deadliest fire in decades
content: At least 128 people have died and hundreds remain unaccounted for following the fire which engulfed several tower blocks.

title: Guinea-Bissau coup was a sham, West African political figures say
content: Senegal's prime minister and Nigeria's former leader say they do not believe the military takeover was genuine.

title: Trump says he will pardon ex-Honduras president convicted of drug trafficking
content: Juan Orlando Hern√°ndez was sentenced in the US to 45 years behind bars for conspiring to smuggle cocaine.

title: Hungary's Orban defies EU partners and meets Putin again in Moscow
content: Russia's leader praised what he called Orban's "balanced position on the situation in Ukraine".

title: Thirteen killed in deadliest Israeli raid for months in southern Syria
content: Israel said it was targeting militants in the village of Beit Jinn, but Syria's foreign ministry condemns what it called a "war crime".

title: Runaway nuns can stay in Alpine convent if they leave social media
content: The three nuns say they were taken out of the convent against their will and placed in a care home.

title: Afghans in US issue plea to Trump after Washington DC shooting
content: People who left Afghanistan urge the US president not to toughen his stance after an attack allegedly carried out by an Afghan national.

title: UN panel says Israel operating 'de facto policy of torture'
content: Rights groups gave harrowing details about conditions in Israeli detention centres. Israel has not responded but has previously denied allegations of torture.

title: Ex-president's daughter resigns over allegations she duped South Africans to fight for Russia
content: Her resignation comes as a South African allegedly recruited to fight in Ukraine recounts the horrors of war to the BBC.

title: Lightning detected on Mars for the first time, scientists say
content: Researchers heard electric crackles on 28 hours of recordings made over two Martian years.

title: Tunisia hands prison terms to dozens of opposition figures
content: The defendants were accused of attempting a coup - but human rights groups say the trial was politically motivated.

title: Why the rich and powerful couldn't say no to Epstein
content: The late sex offender maintained contact with wealthy and influential people even after his first conviction.

title: How Trump's pledge to tackle Sudan atrocities could play out
content: The war is being fuelled by regional powers and the US president may have some leverage over them.

title: How were Afghan evacuees vetted under Biden?
content: BBC Verify looks into claims that the Afghan national suspected of shooting two National Guard members in Washington DC entered the US unvetted.

title: 'This was preventable': Anger and unanswered questions after Hong Kong fire
content: Questions are mounting as to how the deadly fire spread so rapidly - and who should be held responsible.

title: The kidnap gangs, jihadists and separatists wreaking havoc in Nigeria
content: The country faces many deadly security challenges, leaving the army and police severely overstretched.

title: What we know about shooting of National Guard in Washington DC
content: Sarah Beckstrom, 20, has died, while Andrew Wolfe, 24, remains in a critical condition.

title: Scores killed as floods sweep several Asian nations
content: At least 80 people have died in Indonesia with another 56 dead in Sri Lanka in a week of extreme weather.

title: Watch: Pope struggles to remove cloth covering plaque
content: It took several attemps for Pope Leo and church clergy to unveil a plaque covered by a white sheet at an Istanbul cathedral.

title: Video shows speed fire spreads in Hong Kong tower block
content: Footage geolocated by BBC Verify show the blaze taking hold in Wang Cheong House.

title: Watch: Dawn aerial footage reveals scale of Hong Kong apartment blaze
content: More than 800 firefighters were still tackling the blaze at Wang Fuk Court this morning.

title: Watch: How the shooting of two National Guard members unfolded
content: The two soldiers are in critical condition after being attacked blocks from the White House in Washington DC.
